alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 8:08PM CDT until March 27 at 2:17AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... Jacks Fork at Eminence affecting Shannon County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Jacks Fork at Eminence. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, flood waters impact City Park and other low lying areas in the city of Eminence. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM CDT Friday was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.2 feet on 12/29/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
